headline: US futures, Asian shares slip, tracking Wall Street's retreat, while oil falls more than $2
summary: U.S. futures and Asian shares skidded Monday and oil prices fell more than $2 a barrel.  In South Korea, the Kospi tumbled 4.6% to 4,982.54 as worries revived over a potential bubble in the craze for artificial intelligence.  Samsung Electronics gave up 3.5%, while chip maker SK Hynix sank 5.6%.

content.title: US futures, Asian shares slip, tracking Wall Street's retreat, while oil falls more than $2
content.summary: U.S. futures and Asian shares skidded Monday and oil prices fell more than $2 a barrel.  In South Korea, the Kospi tumbled 4.6% to 4,982.54 as worries revived over a potential bubble in the craze for artificial intelligence.  Samsung Electronics gave up 3.5%, while chip maker SK Hynix sank 5.6%.

thumbnail.caption: A currency trader talks on the phone near a screen showing the Korea Composite Stock Price Index (KOSPI), top center, and the foreign exchange rate between U.S. dollar and South Korean won, top center left, at the foreign exchange dealing room of the Hana Bank headquarters in Seoul, South Korea, Friday, Jan. 30, 2026. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)

headline: Why Amazon's cloud revenue growth looks promising this year
summary: Big Tech earnings are underway, with Meta (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Tesla (TSLA), and Apple (AAPL) having reported last week and Amazon (AMZN) and Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) reporting this week.WestEnd Capital Management senior equity analyst Ali Mogharabi joins Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss his expectations for cloud revenue growth this year.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Why Amazon's cloud revenue growth looks promising this year
content.description:
Big Tech earnings are underway, with Meta (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Tesla (TSLA), and Apple (AAPL) having reported last week and Amazon (AMZN) and Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) reporting this week.

WestEnd Capital Management senior equity analyst Ali Mogharabi joins Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss his expectations for cloud revenue growth this year.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Chinese EV Makers Hit Speed Bump
summary: Chinese electric-vehicle stocks dropped on Monday after manufacturers reported weak January sales due to waning government support. Market leader BYD said it sold about 210,000 vehicles in the month— down 30% from January last year and missing expectations, according to Citi.

content.title: Chinese EV Makers Hit Speed Bump
content.summary: Chinese electric-vehicle stocks dropped on Monday after manufacturers reported weak January sales due to waning government support. Market leader BYD said it sold about 210,000 vehicles in the month— down 30% from January last year and missing expectations, according to Citi.

headline: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

content.title: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
content.summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

headline: Elon Musk Is Said in Advanced Talks to Combine SpaceX, xAI
summary: Representatives for SpaceX and xAI didn’t respond to requests for comment outside regular business hours.  The rate at which xAI has been burning through cash — around $1 billion a month — has compelled Musk to further blur corporate boundaries, pool capital and rethink whether his moonshots should stay separate.

content.title: Elon Musk Is Said in Advanced Talks to Combine SpaceX, xAI
content.summary: Representatives for SpaceX and xAI didn’t respond to requests for comment outside regular business hours.  The rate at which xAI has been burning through cash — around $1 billion a month — has compelled Musk to further blur corporate boundaries, pool capital and rethink whether his moonshots should stay separate.

headline: Tesla Made A Little-Known Family Insanely Rich With a $2.9B Deal—Then Cybertruck Delays Wiped Out More Than 99.9% of It
summary: One South Korean family saw their fortune swell past $800 million on paper — not from an IPO, not from real estate, not from crypto — but from a battery deal with Tesla. Less than two years later, the value of that contract was quietly revised down to just $7,386. Yes, from $2.9 billion to $7,386. A 99.9997% collapse. Behind the swing is L&F Co., a manufacturer of high-nickel cathode materials used in electric vehicle batteries. In February 2023, the company signed a supply agreement with Tesla

content.title: Tesla Made A Little-Known Family Insanely Rich With a $2.9B Deal—Then Cybertruck Delays Wiped Out More Than 99.9% of It
content.summary: One South Korean family saw their fortune swell past $800 million on paper — not from an IPO, not from real estate, not from crypto — but from a battery deal with Tesla. Less than two years later, the value of that contract was quietly revised down to just $7,386. Yes, from $2.9 billion to $7,386. A 99.9997% collapse. Behind the swing is L&F Co., a manufacturer of high-nickel cathode materials used in electric vehicle batteries. In February 2023, the company signed a supply agreement with Tesla

headline: Tesla Stock Falls. Ford Could Help Bring Chinese EVs to America.
summary: Tesla  stock fell early Monday after a report that  Ford Motor  was considering a collaboration with Chinese electric-vehicle makers.  Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.

content.title: Tesla Stock Falls. Ford Could Help Bring Chinese EVs to America.
content.summary: Tesla  stock fell early Monday after a report that  Ford Motor  was considering a collaboration with Chinese electric-vehicle makers.  Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.

headline: Retirees and Income Investors Missed QQQM’s 108% Return By Focusing On The Wrong Thing
summary: The Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (NASDAQ:QQQM) doesn’t generate income the way traditional dividend ETFs do. With a yield of just 0.51%, this fund tracks growth-focused technology companies that reinvest profits rather than distribute them. The modest distributions come entirely from whatever dividends the underlying holdings choose to pay, which explains why income investors typically look ... Retirees and Income Investors Missed QQQM’s 108% Return By Focusing On The Wrong Thing

content.title: Retirees and Income Investors Missed QQQM’s 108% Return By Focusing On The Wrong Thing

With a yield of just 0.51%, this fund tracks growth-focused technology companies that reinvest profits rather than distribute them. The modest distributions come entirely from whatever dividends the underlying holdings choose to pay, which explains why income investors typically look ...
